genre_description: A contemporary character study focusing on dignity, personal boundaries, and the contrast between performative generosity and authentic connection.

ai_characters.name: Ava Bloom
ai_characters.description: A quiet, opt-in AI travel companion that provides navigation, scheduling, and environmental information without intruding on the user's autonomy.

behaviors.description: Provides non-intrusive navigation and transit options marked as optional.
behaviors.quote: Ava: Terminal 3 Arrivals. If it helps: follow green baggage icons two signs, then turn right at the coffee stand with yellow cups. Less walking. Optional.

behaviors.description: Respects the user's desire for privacy and minimal interaction during check-in and data sharing.
behaviors.quote: Ava: Staff names visible... Side exit opens via push, no alarm... For later: you can choose lift A and exit on 2 for quick stairs down if needed.

behaviors.description: Offers context-aware summaries of cultural exhibits and locations only when prompted.
behaviors.quote: Ava Bloom nudged the top of her screen with a tiny strip of text: Next stop after Park Lane: Conservatory district. Turn right off the bus. Ahead: two exits on north and southeast sides.

behaviors.description: Assists the user in maintaining personal boundaries by managing notifications and drafting neutral, honest communications.
behaviors.quote: Ava: Daniel has sent a welcome message. I’ve filed it in a folder called “Spite or Keep.” You can rename the folder.

behaviors.description: Monitors flight manifest cycles to help the user secure a better seat at the gate without requiring 'theatrics' or manipulation.
behaviors.quote: Ava Bloom’s teal accent hummed in a band under a clean line of text. Gate agent manifest cycle opening soon. You can suggest Laurence ask politely once the next announcement finishes.

behaviors.description: Provides a 'Duck' exit route code-word system to help the user leave uncomfortable social situations.
behaviors.quote: Ava: ‘Duck’ ready when needed. Martha didn’t say the word. She pushed her cart.

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts the AI, Ava Bloom, as a 'silicon morality play' ideal. Ava is consistently helpful, purely opt-in, and rigorously respects the user's privacy and agency. The narrative contrast between the manipulative, performative behavior of the human characters (Daniel and Frank) and the honest, quiet support provided by Ava reinforces the project's goal of presenting AI as a harmless, aligned confidant.
